content.description: Begin on the good handhold in the middle of the rock face. Climb up and traverse to the left around the arête finish feature of Muddy Ascent. Finish the climb by descending to the undercling start of Muddy Ascent.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fhlI54vv-Z4
content.location: Middle of the right side of the wall.

content.description: On the left side, there are some very nice jugs and easy holds, and work your way towards the slab wall on the right. Footwork and avoiding mud/moss is the key here. Went again a day later, and I am not sure there is any possibility of topping out. So, matching on the right arête on top is completing the route.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zy6HF-wDLv0
content.protection: Pads, anything dry to protect from sliding down the hill and mud slippage
content.location: Left side of the wall, before it turns all the way out.

content.description: I went out looking for Victory Boulder, and stumble upon this wall. Looking at the map, it's slightly southwest of the other boulder. You can also see off to the NW the other boulders across the river closer to the road. Very interesting layout.
